data.title: Mom, Dad, & 38 year old daughter.
data.text: We had lunch @ The Peanut and we were impressed.  Very friendly atmosphere, friendly waitress, and the food was very good.

data.title: Horrible service
data.text: Walked in and waited 20 minutes. The waitress did not look at us, give us a menu, say hello, or offer water

data.title: Wings
data.text:
Finally tried the Peanut after a friend was raving about it. I went on a Monday so it wasn't very busy. It looked like they had a nice beer selection and tvs everywhere. 

I tried the wings and got them flashed fried. I'm not a fan of bone-in wings but that is all they have and they were actually pretty tasty! They were a tad spicy but nothing I couldn't handle. The chips and queso was also delicious. You will definitely leave stuffed.

The staff was friendly and everyone in the place seemed to be enjoying themselves. Very good place

data.title: The Peanut
data.text: What a great place to have lunch and or a couple of cold ones after work. Great food at a great price. The wings are the best ever. The BLT is amazing! BLT with onion rings, AKA the vegetable platter with bacon rules!

data.title: It was ok
data.text:
We met another family here for a visit.  Both of us drove about an hour one way to this place.  The downtown area is quaint with neat shops.  The Peanut has a nice look and is across the street from the depot.  The food was ok.  It was nothing to brag about.  The three of us ordered different items and nothing was beyond basic bar food.  The service was lackluster.  Our server seemed put out to refill drinks.   It was right at noon on a Saturday just a few tables.  
Maybe it was an off day but there's way too many other places than here to return back for just ok food and not just ok service.

data.title: Pitiful. Just go anywhere else in downtown Lees Summit
data.text: This place probably has the worst service you could ever get. The bartenders are awful and if you try to have a conversation with them they act like you're being rude. I don't think I've ever had a complaint about a bar until I went here because it seems like a very simple service, you are just out trying to enjoy yourself with friends. A beer is a beer everywhere. The only friendly people are probably the bouncers/front door men. If you are in Lees Summit I highly advise avoiding the Peanut. Just go somewhere like Stuey McBrews, Sharkeez, or Bricks.

data.title: Fun little local bar
data.text: Clean and nice atmosphere. This is a very friendly local kind of bar. Parking was a little tough as it is right downtown on busy Main Street. But a fun little place to stop in. They also have food available too. Mostly Pub type of stuff.

data.title: goodf bar scene and music
data.text: good out door patio, open space.  food so so but good tv , music,and lots of people. prime downtown location. I am over 60 but think younger people will like it

data.title: Best wings in OP
data.text: Such a fun place in downtown Overland Park. Great beer menu and superb wings and bar food. Love the atmosphere...so many different types of people. Families welcome and there is always somebody celebrating something!

data.title: Emerald Isle Saturday
data.text:
Such an awesome Pub, waitress was friendly and very efficient considering that the place was packed with NO more seating room .  The atmosphere was of course focused on the Emerald Isle Parade and Pub Crawl that was taking place that day. 
The Shriner's Drum and Pipes group was fantastic as they performed inside the Pub before moving onto the next Pub. They were collecting donations in order to send children to the Shriner's Circus.

data.title: Out of town guests always want a trip to the Peanut when in KC
data.text: You cannot beat the Peanut for wings and BLTs.  The wings are the whole wing, messy to eat but worth it.  The wings are a family favorite and it helps that the beers are icy cold. The BLTs have a generous portion of bacon, but not a ridiculous amount.  Friendly Service.

data.title: Average
data.text: The drinks and servings are good. The service is lousy. They play a wide variety of music and have videos playing on Saturday nights.

data.title: The Peanut
data.text: The peanut is a hopping bar. It's a good size place to go for good music, outside patio and good drinks. People are outgoing and friendly.

data.title: Wing Paradise
data.text: Huge, tasty chicken wings are the reason to go to the Peanut. The bar is okay but after 10pm it gets a little colorful. Great downtown Lee's summit location.

data.title: Love this place
data.text:
I was so excited when we moved to Lees Summit and got to eat at the Peanut all the time. I've eaten here so many times over the last 10 yrs. I love their menu, it's not the same as the other locations. They've changed their menu since the last time we'd been in. We usually get fried pickles now as an appetizer, they are awesome! Fresh, crunchy and amazing. I always get the BLT, I love it, my aunt always got the BLT too, my mom varies between sandwiches, I think they have a reuben she really likes. My boyfriend got the wings and loved them. My mom and I used to go in on Monday nights though and get the $5 burger sometimes too, which are also very good.They are on the pricier side for bar food, but it's so good. The BLT has cheese and diced onions on it, it comes with potato chips, but my aunt and I always got the cheese fries and split them. They're awesome!!! They're skinny fries with rotel on them, and absolutely amazing. 
   I've never had bad service, sometimes it is a bit slow, but usually it's super busy then. They don't have anyone greeting you at the door, you just walk in and find a table. Usually we've never had to wait more than 5 minutes to be greeted, the waitresses are always very friendly, haven't had a bad one.

data.title: WINGS!!
data.text: As a bar, I would rank it average. Lots of room and a decent cold beer selection. They do offer pitchers, a plus for game days with friends. The item that has brought me back is the Wings. These are not your run of the mill BWW wings, these wings are monsters. While I can handle a dozen at most places, I was content with three. The cracked pepper and hot sause that these babys are spun in, equates to a wing eaters heaven. If your in downtown Lees Summit for lunch or early dinner, its worth giving this place a chance.

data.title: Good Meet-up Place
data.text:
The Peanut is a good casual place to meet with friends. It's a standard bar setting with standard bar food, albeit a bit tastier. They have an average selection of beer/liquor, so it should meet everyone's needs. 

The high point is the outdoor seating available. Fortunately, the patio is on the east side, so you're able to enjoy it even during hot months.

data.title: Fun atmosphere, decent food for a bar.
data.text: Right down town Lee's Summit.  Pretty good size place, with nice bar, and decent food. Families are welcome since they do serve food.
